snippet: An odd way of climbing stairs leads to the discovery of an illness.
abstract: Lisa Sanders Diagnosis column details the difficult diagnosis of a young woman who suffered from late-onset Tay-Sachs disease, a devastating neurological disease that leads to muscle weakness. (M)
lead_paragraph: ''You need to see a doctor,'' the woman told her 27-year-old daughter. ''Really,'' she insisted. ''I'm worried.'' Her daughter, who lived several states away, was visiting, and when the mother happened to see her go up the stairs, she was struck by how odd this simple, everyday action looked. Her daughter's slender hips rocked from side to side as she moved up the steps. It was as if she had to lift her entire body to bring up each leg. Her mother was certain that something was wrong. 1.
